title: Baked Trout with Shiitake Mushrooms, Tomatoes, and Ginger
summary: Need a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian main course? Baked Trout with Shiitake Mushrooms, Tomatoes, and Ginger could be an amazing recipe to try. This recipe serves 2 and costs $6.33 per serving. One portion of this dish contains roughly 72g of protein, 16g of fat, and a total of 469 calories. If you have rainbow trout, asian sesame oil, shiitake mushrooms, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the fresh ginger you could follow this main course with the Fresh Ginger Cookies as a dessert. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 40 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is outstanding. Similar recipes include Baked Trout With Shiitake Mushrooms, Tomatoes And Ginger, Baked Trout With Shiitake Mushrooms And Tomatoes, and Baked Trout with Shiitake Mushroom Pesto.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Preheat oven to 400°F. Line large rimmed baking sheet with foil; coat with nonstick spray. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Open fish like a book and arrange, skin side down, on prepared baking sheet.                                                                Mix next 5 ingredients in bowl. Sprinkle mixture over fish, drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil, then top with cilantro sprigs. Bake uncovered until fish is opaque in center, about 20 minutes.                                                                         Per serving: Calories 431.45 (% from fat 35.4), 17.18 g fat (4.14 g saturated), 282.36 mg cholesterol, 8.15 g carbohydrates, 1.48 g dietary fiber, 3.60 g total sugars, 6.68 g net carbohydrates, 58.78 g proteinSee Nutrition Data's analysis ›                            Nutritional analysis provided by                                        Gourmet

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line large rimmed baking sheet with foil; coat with nonstick spray.
Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Open fish like a book and arrange, skin side down, on prepared baking sheet.
Sprinkle mixture over fish, drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil, then top with cilantro sprigs.
Bake uncovered until fish is opaque in center, about 20 minutes.
